children.subject: I'd like to add on, for this sem, the professors for Data 8 are amazing. You should definitely consider taking it b/c of that. Adhikari might not give the easiest assignments or tests, but she'll still teach the class very well. And Wagner is also awesome and really caring for his students. When I took Data 8, it wasn't much workload and kind of like your standard introductory course. I doubt switching to Econ 1 would make a difference (never taken that class tho), unless you really don't care about data science or statistics. Although some people have different opinions, I found Data 8 to be more of "breadth-level" difficulty if you have any experience with CS or Stats.
+1 that 61c is (imo unnecessarily) high workload. This semester I am taking 61c + 70 + breadth and finding the workload much higher than last semester's, 61b + 16a + 2 breadths.
Do you think it's the same workload regardless of whether the prof is garcia or weaver?
Garcia is significantly less workload in general, though in fa20 he bumped it up to match Weaver’s

<md>I don't know about actual hours but IMO:

61C is a high workload class. I will say that I would classify a lot of it as brute work or busy work since you will spend a lot of time fighting C or assembly and whatnot to make your code work. Conceptually, the class is also the first foray into low-level software and hardware that most people have, so it can have a learning curve if you have no idea what is going on.

CS 170 is a pset class. It has pretty lengthy psets each week, standard midterms, and both a project and a final. Pretty standard class for the workload, comparable to 127 or 182 in terms of time I would say. 

I don't know about Data 8 or Econ 1.

If you are confident in your self, you can add another breath (I did that year)

61C and 16B at this point are the same level of workload and difficulty I would say.</md>
I took that schedule + math 53 and it was chill

history.content:
As in, how many hows for each class per week should I expect these three classes to take?

Would switching Data 8 with Econ 1 make some sort of a difference?

Do you think I'll have room to add one more breadth?

Also, actually, would switching 61C with EECS16B ease the workload a little more?
history.subject: How much workload can I expect for taking 61C + CS 170 + Data 8?
